title: Mary Earps - Wikipedia
snippet: On 29 June 2024, Manchester United confirmed Earps had left the club upon the expiry of her contract. On 1 July 2024, Earps joined Première Ligue club Paris Saint-Germain on a two-year contract until June 2026. She and Paris Saint-Germain lost 5–2 on aggregate to Juventus in the 2024–25 ...

title: England Women's player profile: Mary Earps | England Football
snippet: After five years at Old Trafford and helping the club to their first ever Women's FA Cup title in 2024, Mary took on a new challenge by joining French giants Paris Saint-Germain. Earps called time on her spell with the Lionesses in May 2025, after collecting a total of 53 caps.

title: Mary Earps’ Manchester United return: Jeers, cheers, selfies and a painful defeat - The Athletic
snippet: 13, 2025 ... Sporting a bright yellow Paris Saint-Germain goalkeeping kit, hips swaying from side to side, Mary Earps looked up towards Old Trafford’s Sir Bobby Charlton Stand. Game mode was activated for the return of the ‘Mearps’ in ...

title: England goalkeeper Mary Earps announces international retirement before Euro 2025 - The Athletic
snippet: She plays her club football for Paris Saint-Germain, who she joined in July after five years at Manchester United. Earps came fifth in Ballon d’Or voting in 2023 and won the 2023-24 FA Cup with United.

title: Mary Earps extract: ‘I felt sick and anxious. Then came the words I’d waited 12 months to hear’ | Mary Earps | The Guardian
snippet: Mary Earps: ‘In April 2025 I went to St George’s Park with my head up, even if I was working extra hard to keep it that way, not knowing exactly how things were going to play out.
